      <article id="post-671" class="post-671 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-android tag-android-2 tag-http tag-httpclient tag-internet"> 
       <header class="entry-header"> 
        <h1 class="entry-title">Android Internet Connection Using HTTP GET (HttpClient)</h1> 
       </header>
       <!-- .entry-header --> 
       <div class="entry-content"> 
        <p><a href="http://hmkcode.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/09/android-http-get_2.png"><img class="size-full wp-image-696 alignleft" alt="android-http-get_2" src="http://hmkcode.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/09/android-http-get_2.png" width="350" height="234"></a>One common task for most Android apps is connecting to the Internet. Most network-connected Android apps use HTTP to send and receive data.This article shows you how to write a simple application that connects to the Internet, send HTTP GET request &amp; display the response.</p> 
        <p>&nbsp;</p> 
        <h3><span id="more-671"></span></h3> 
        <h3><strong>Objectives:</strong></h3> 
        <ul> 
         <li>How to send HTTP GET request to a web server and display the response?</li> 
         <li>How to check network connection?</li> 
         <li>How to use AsyncTask to perform network operations on a separate thread?</li> 
        </ul> 
        <h3><strong>Environment &amp; Tools:</strong></h3> 
        <ul> 
         <li>Android Developer Tools (ADT) (or Eclipse + ADT plugin)</li> 
         <li>AVD Nexus S Android 4.3 “emulator”</li> 
         <li>Min SDK 8</li> 
         <li><strong></strong><a href="http://hmkcode.com/examples/index.php">http://hmkcode.com/examples/index.php</a> this page will return simple string “HMKCODE HTTP Example”</li> 
        </ul> 
        <h2><strong>( 1 ) Create Android Application<br> </strong></h2> 
        <ul> 
         <li><strong>File</strong> &gt;&gt; <strong>New</strong> &gt;&gt; <strong>Android Application</strong></li> 
         <li>App Name: <strong>HTTP App</strong></li> 
         <li>Enter Project Name: <strong>android-http-client</strong></li> 
         <li>Pakcage: <strong>com.hmkcode.android</strong></li> 
         <li>Keep other defualt selections, go <strong>Next&nbsp;</strong> till you reach&nbsp;<strong>Finish</strong></li> 
        </ul> 
        <h2><strong>( 2 ) Activity UI Layout &amp; Views<br> </strong></h2> 
        <p><img alt="" src="data:image/png;base64,"></p> 
        <p>The layout is linear layout includes the following views:</p> 
        <ul> 
         <li>One <strong>TextView</strong> to show the network connection status.</li> 
         <li>One <strong>EditText</strong> to show the response from the web server.</li> 
        </ul> 
        <ul style="list-style-type: square;"> 
         <li><strong>/res/layout/main.xml</strong></li> 
        </ul> 
        <pre class="brush: xml; gutter: true">&lt;?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?&gt;
&lt;LinearLayout xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"
    android:layout_width="match_parent"
    android:layout_height="match_parent"
    android:orientation="vertical" &gt;

   &lt;TextView
        android:id="@+id/tvIsConnected"
        android:layout_width="wrap_content"
        android:layout_height="wrap_content"
        android:layout_gravity="center_horizontal"     
        android:background="#FF0000"
        android:textColor="#FFF"
        android:textSize="18dp"
        android:layout_marginBottom="5dp"
        android:text="is connected? " /&gt;

    &lt;EditText
        android:id="@+id/etResponse"
        android:layout_width="match_parent"
        android:layout_height="200dp"
        android:ems="10"
        android:layout_marginTop="10dp"
        android:inputType="textMultiLine" &gt;

        &lt;requestFocus /&gt;
    &lt;/EditText&gt;

&lt;/LinearLayout&gt;</pre> 
        <h2><strong>( 3 ) Activity Class</strong></h2> 
        <p>The class includes the following methods:</p> 
        <ul> 
         <li><strong>onCreate</strong>(): gets reference to UI views, checks the connection &amp; makes the HTTP GET call.</li> 
         <li><strong>GET</strong>(url): opens HTTP connection, sends HTTP GET request to “<a href="http://hmkcode.com/examples/index.php"><span style="color: #3366ff;">http://hmkcode.com/examples/index.php</span></a>” &amp; receives the response.</li> 
         <li><strong>convertInputStreamToString</strong>(): helper method to convert input stream to string.</li> 
         <li><strong>isConnected</strong>(): checks if you have network connection.</li> 
        </ul> 
        <ul style="list-style-type: square;"> 
         <li><strong>/src/com/hmkcode/android/MainActivity.java</strong></li> 
        </ul> 
        <pre class="brush: java; gutter: true">package com.hmkcode.android;

import java.io.BufferedReader;
import java.io.IOException;
import java.io.InputStream;
import java.io.InputStreamReader;
import org.apache.http.HttpResponse;
import org.apache.http.client.HttpClient;
import org.apache.http.client.methods.HttpGet;
import org.apache.http.impl.client.DefaultHttpClient;
import android.net.ConnectivityManager;
import android.net.NetworkInfo;
import android.os.Bundle;
import android.util.Log;
import android.widget.EditText;
import android.widget.TextView;
import android.app.Activity;

public class MainActivity extends Activity {

	EditText etResponse;
	TextView tvIsConnected;
	@Override
	protected void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState) {
		super.onCreate(savedInstanceState);
		setContentView(R.layout.main);

		// get reference to the views
		etResponse = (EditText) findViewById(R.id.etResponse);
		tvIsConnected = (TextView) findViewById(R.id.tvIsConnected);

		// check if you are connected or not
		if(isConnected()){
			tvIsConnected.setBackgroundColor(0xFF00CC00);
			tvIsConnected.setText("You are conncted");
        }
		else{
			tvIsConnected.setText("You are NOT conncted");
		}

		// show response on the EditText etResponse 
		etResponse.setText(GET("http://hmkcode.com/examples/index.php"));

	}

	public static String GET(String url){
		InputStream inputStream = null;
		String result = "";
		try {

			// create HttpClient
			HttpClient httpclient = new DefaultHttpClient();

			// make GET request to the given URL
			HttpResponse httpResponse = httpclient.execute(new HttpGet(url));

			// receive response as inputStream
			inputStream = httpResponse.getEntity().getContent();

			// convert inputstream to string
			if(inputStream != null)
				result = convertInputStreamToString(inputStream);
			else
				result = "Did not work!";

		} catch (Exception e) {
			Log.d("InputStream", e.getLocalizedMessage());
		}

		return result;
	}

	// convert inputstream to String
    private static String convertInputStreamToString(InputStream inputStream) throws IOException{
        BufferedReader bufferedReader = new BufferedReader( new InputStreamReader(inputStream));
        String line = "";
        String result = "";
        while((line = bufferedReader.readLine()) != null)
            result += line;

        inputStream.close();
        return result;

    }

    // check network connection
    public boolean isConnected(){
    	ConnectivityManager connMgr = (ConnectivityManager) getSystemService(this.CONNECTIVITY_SERVICE);
    	    NetworkInfo networkInfo = connMgr.getActiveNetworkInfo();
    	    if (networkInfo != null &amp;&amp; networkInfo.isConnected()) 
    	    	return true;
    	    else
    	    	return false;	
    }

}</pre> 
        <p>To run this code you need to add the following permissions to manifest file.</p> 
        <pre>&lt;uses-permission android:name="android.permission.INTERNET" /&gt;
&lt;uses-permission android:name="android.permission.ACCESS_NETWORK_STATE" /&gt;</pre> 
        <h3><strong>Will work but on older version!</strong></h3> 
        <p><span style="color: #ff0000;"><strong>This code “<span style="text-decoration: underline;"><em>up to this step</em></span>” will work on older version of Android “before 3.0? to make this working on newer version we need to run network operations on a Separate Thread using AsyncTask</strong></span></p> 
        <h2><strong>( 4 ) Perform Network Operations Using AsyncTask</strong></h2> 
        <p>Network operations can be slow which may cause a poor user experience. To prevent this slowness, make network operations on a separate thread from the UI. <code>Using <a href="http://developer.android.com/reference/android/os/AsyncTask.html" onclick="javascript:_gaq.push(['_trackEvent','outbound-article','http://developer.android.com']);">AsyncTask</a></code> class we can simply separate network operation task from the UI thread.</p> 
        <p>In the same class&nbsp;<strong>MainActivity.java</strong> add the following private class</p> 
        <pre class="brush: java; gutter: true">.......
private class HttpAsyncTask extends AsyncTask&lt;String, Void, String&gt; {
        @Override
        protected String doInBackground(String... urls) {

            return GET(urls[0]);
        }
        // onPostExecute displays the results of the AsyncTask.
        @Override
        protected void onPostExecute(String result) {
        	Toast.makeText(getBaseContext(), "Received!", Toast.LENGTH_LONG).show();
        	etResponse.setText(result);
       }
    }</pre> 
        <p>Notice that <strong>doInBackground</strong>() will make the GET(url) call and <strong>onPostExecute</strong>() will set the result on EditView “etResponse”.</p> 
        <p>Now to make the HTTP GET request use the below code,</p> 
        <pre class="brush: java; gutter: true">new HttpAsyncTask().execute("http://hmkcode.com/examples/index.php");</pre> 
        <p>notice that <strong>doInBackground</strong>() &amp; <strong>onPostExecute</strong>() will be called <em>implicitly</em> i.e. we are not calling them directly AsyncTask will call them for us, we just call the <strong>execute</strong>().</p> 
        <h3><strong>Complete Code:</strong></h3> 
        <ul style="list-style-type: square;"> 
         <li><strong>/src/com/hmkcode/android/MainActivity.java</strong></li> 
        </ul> 
        <pre class="brush: java; gutter: true">package com.hmkcode.android;

import java.io.BufferedReader;
import java.io.IOException;
import java.io.InputStream;
import java.io.InputStreamReader;

import org.apache.http.HttpResponse;
import org.apache.http.client.HttpClient;
import org.apache.http.client.methods.HttpGet;
import org.apache.http.impl.client.DefaultHttpClient;

import android.net.ConnectivityManager;
import android.net.NetworkInfo;
import android.os.AsyncTask;
import android.os.Bundle;
import android.util.Log;
import android.widget.EditText;
import android.widget.TextView;
import android.widget.Toast;
import android.app.Activity;

public class MainActivity extends Activity {

	EditText etResponse;
	TextView tvIsConnected;
	@Override
	protected void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState) {
		super.onCreate(savedInstanceState);
		setContentView(R.layout.main);

		// get reference to the views
		etResponse = (EditText) findViewById(R.id.etResponse);
		tvIsConnected = (TextView) findViewById(R.id.tvIsConnected);

		// check if you are connected or not
		if(isConnected()){
			tvIsConnected.setBackgroundColor(0xFF00CC00);
			tvIsConnected.setText("You are conncted");
        }
		else{
			tvIsConnected.setText("You are NOT conncted");
		}

		// show response on the EditText etResponse 
		//etResponse.setText(GET("http://hmkcode.com/examples/index.php"));

		// call AsynTask to perform network operation on separate thread
		new HttpAsyncTask().execute("http://hmkcode.com/examples/index.php");
	}

	public static String GET(String url){
		InputStream inputStream = null;
		String result = "";
		try {

			// create HttpClient
			HttpClient httpclient = new DefaultHttpClient();

			// make GET request to the given URL
			HttpResponse httpResponse = httpclient.execute(new HttpGet(url));

			// receive response as inputStream
			inputStream = httpResponse.getEntity().getContent();

			// convert inputstream to string
			if(inputStream != null)
				result = convertInputStreamToString(inputStream);
			else
				result = "Did not work!";

		} catch (Exception e) {
			Log.d("InputStream", e.getLocalizedMessage());
		}

		return result;
	}

    private static String convertInputStreamToString(InputStream inputStream) throws IOException{
        BufferedReader bufferedReader = new BufferedReader( new InputStreamReader(inputStream));
        String line = "";
        String result = "";
        while((line = bufferedReader.readLine()) != null)
            result += line;

        inputStream.close();
        return result;

    }

    public boolean isConnected(){
    	ConnectivityManager connMgr = (ConnectivityManager) getSystemService(this.CONNECTIVITY_SERVICE);
    	    NetworkInfo networkInfo = connMgr.getActiveNetworkInfo();
    	    if (networkInfo != null &amp;&amp; networkInfo.isConnected()) 
    	    	return true;
    	    else
    	    	return false;	
    }
    private class HttpAsyncTask extends AsyncTask&lt;String, Void, String&gt; {
        @Override
        protected String doInBackground(String... urls) {

            return GET(urls[0]);
        }
        // onPostExecute displays the results of the AsyncTask.
        @Override
        protected void onPostExecute(String result) {
        	Toast.makeText(getBaseContext(), "Received!", Toast.LENGTH_LONG).show();
        	etResponse.setText(result);
       }
    }

}</pre> 
        <h2><strong>&nbsp;( 5 ) Manifest XML File</strong></h2> 
        <ul style="list-style-type: square;"> 
         <li><strong>/AndroidManifest.xml</strong></li> 
        </ul> 
        <pre class="brush: xml; gutter: true; highlight:[11,12]">&lt;?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?&gt;
&lt;manifest xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"
    package="com.hmkcode.android"
    android:versionCode="1"
    android:versionName="1.0" &gt;

    &lt;uses-sdk
        android:minSdkVersion="8"
        android:targetSdkVersion="17" /&gt;

    &lt;uses-permission android:name="android.permission.INTERNET" /&gt;
    &lt;uses-permission android:name="android.permission.ACCESS_NETWORK_STATE" /&gt;

    &lt;application
        android:allowBackup="true"
        android:icon="@drawable/ic_launcher"
        android:label="@string/app_name"
        android:theme="@style/AppTheme" &gt;
        &lt;activity
            android:name="com.hmkcode.android.MainActivity"
            android:label="@string/app_name" &gt;
            &lt;intent-filter&gt;
                &lt;action android:name="android.intent.action.MAIN" /&gt;

                &lt;category android:name="android.intent.category.LAUNCHER" /&gt;
            &lt;/intent-filter&gt;
        &lt;/activity&gt;
    &lt;/application&gt;

&lt;/manifest&gt;</pre>
